Package org.securecryptoconfig

Interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface

All Known Implementing Classes:
SecureCryptoConfig
interface SecureCryptoConfigInterface
Interface that defines which methods should be used for cryptography operations.
Author:
Kai

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    PlaintextContainerInterface decryptAsymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey keyPair, AbstractSCCCiphertext ciphertext)
    Asymmetric decryption with a certain SCCKey for a given SCCCiphertext.

  • Method Details

    • encryptSymmetric

      AbstractSCCCiphertext encryptSymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey key, PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext) throws COSE.CoseException, java.security.InvalidKeyException
      Symmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file. A new SCCKey can be created with SCCKey.createKey(org.securecryptoconfig.SCCKey.KeyUseCase) with SCCKey.KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption Alternatively it is also possible to create a key derived from a password with SCCKey.createSymmetricKeyWithPassword(byte[])
      Parameters:
      key - : SCCKey
      plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
      Returns:
      SCCCiphertext
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
      java.security.InvalidKeyException - : If SCCKey has not the SCCKey.KeyType.Symmetric

    • encryptSymmetric

      AbstractSCCCiphertext encryptSymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey key, byte[] plaintext) throws COSE.CoseException, java.security.InvalidKeyException
      Symmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file. A new SCCKey can be created with SCCKey.createKey(org.securecryptoconfig.SCCKey.KeyUseCase) with SCCKey.KeyUseCase.SymmetricEncryption
      Parameters:
      key - : SCCKeySCCKeytext: as byte[]
      Returns:
      SCCCiphertext
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
      java.security.InvalidKeyException

    • reEncryptSymmetric

      AbstractSCCCiphertext reEncryptSymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey key, AbstractSCCCiphertext ciphertext) throws COSE.CoseException, java.security.InvalidKeyException
      Ciphertext will be first decrypted and then encrypted again with the current used Secure Crypto Config file.
      Parameters:
      key - : SCCKey
      ciphertext - : SCCCiphertext
      Returns:
      SCCCiphertext
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
      java.security.InvalidKeyException

    • encryptAsymmetric

      AbstractSCCCiphertext encryptAsymmetric​(AbstractSCCKey keyPair, PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext) throws COSE.CoseException, java.security.InvalidKeyException, SCCException
      Asymmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file. A new SCCKey can be created with SCCKey.createKey(org.securecryptoconfig.SCCKey.KeyUseCase) with SCCKey.KeyUseCase.AsymmetricEncryption
      Parameters:
      keyPair - : SCCKey
      plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
      Returns:
      SCCCiphertext
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
      SCCException
      java.security.InvalidKeyException

      Asymmetric encryption with a certain SCCKey for a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file. A new SCCKey can be created with SCCKey.createKey(org.securecryptoconfig.SCCKey.KeyUseCase) with SCCKey.KeyUseCase.AsymmetricEncryption
      Parameters:
      keyPair - : SCCKey
      plaintext - : as byte[]
      Returns:
      SCCCiphertext
      Throws:

    • updateHash

      AbstractSCCHash updateHash​(PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext, AbstractSCCHash hash) throws COSE.CoseException

    • updateHash

      Returns:
      SCCHash
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException

    • validateHash

      boolean validateHash​(PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext, AbstractSCCHash hash) throws COSE.CoseException
      Validate a given SCCHash for a specific plaintext. The plaintext will be hashed again and compared if the resulting hash is identical to the provided one.
      Parameters:
      plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
      hash - : SCCHash
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException

    • validateHash

      boolean validateHash​(byte[] plaintext, AbstractSCCHash hash) throws COSE.CoseException
      Validate a given SCCHash for a specific plaintext. The plaintext will be hashed again and compared if the resulting hash is identical to the provided one.
      Parameters:
      plaintext - : as byte[]
      hash - : SCCHash
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException

    • sign

      AbstractSCCSignature sign​(AbstractSCCKey keyPair, PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext) throws COSE.CoseException, java.security.InvalidKeyException, SCCException
      Signing of a plaintext with a specific SCCKey based on the current Secure Crypto Config file. A new SCCKey can be created with SCCKey.createKey(org.securecryptoconfig.SCCKey.KeyUseCase) with SCCKey.KeyUseCase.Signing
      Parameters:
      keyPair - : SCCKey
      plaintext - : as PlaintextContainer
      Returns:
      SCCSignature
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
      SCCException
      java.security.InvalidKeyException

    • validatePasswordHash

      boolean validatePasswordHash​(PlaintextContainerInterface password, AbstractSCCPasswordHash passwordhash) throws COSE.CoseException
      Validate a given SCCPasswordHash against given password. The password will be hashed again and compared if resulting hash is identical to the given one.
      Parameters:
      password - : as PlaintextContainer
      passwordhash - : SCCPasswordHash
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException

    • validatePasswordHash

      boolean validatePasswordHash​(byte[] password, AbstractSCCPasswordHash passwordhash) throws COSE.CoseException
      Validate a given SCCPasswordHash against given password. The password will be hashed again and compared if resulting hash is identical to the given one.
      Parameters:
      password - : as byte[]
      passwordhash - : SCCPasswordHash
      Returns:
      boolean
      Throws:
      COSE.CoseException
